name: Journey
description: Building the future of online education as an AI-powered platform that lets students generate personalized learning journeys based on their interests, prior knowledge, and learning goals. Allows users to learn on the go by generating dynamic podcasts from blogs and long-form text-content

name: Seeker
description: An AI copilot for hardware engineers to search, compare, and analyze electronic components using natural language. I led frontend design and development, while contributing to backend and prompt engineering. Seeker is my most sophisticated project to date.

name: BOM Optimizer
description: A Bill-of-Materials (BOM) Optimizer for Electronics Engineers to streamline their component selection process. Leverages Large Language Models to parse BOMs from various sources, visualizes cost trends, and integrates with popular distributors for a seamless checkout experience. Empowers engineers to optimize their designs for cost, quantity, and availability with ease.

name: Kanban Task Manager
description: An accessible, responsive Kanban Task Manager built using Client-Server architecture with dynamic theming and drag-and-drop UI. Backend deployed on AWS and frontend on Netlify via CI/CD on using Github Actions. Security handled with HTTPS/SSL on AWS Application Load Balancer.

name: Emergency Social Network
description: An emergency communication system for real-time SOS messaging during earthquakes. Built in a fast paced Agile environment with a team of 5. The app was designed and developed the project using Object Oriented Analysis and Programming principles.

name: Rock Paper Scissors Lizard Spock
description: Built a Rock Paper Scissors Lizard Spock game based on a Frontend Mentor design. I worked on this project when I challenged myself to learn and apply NextJS in a project. The game includes a score tracker and can be played comfortably on either desktop or mobile.

name: Product Preview Card
description: At the very start of my CSS journey, I built this responsive product preview card. I used vanilla CSS to build this project diving into the world of flexbox and CSS variables. While the project is simple, it was a great learning experience for me and gave me the confidence to build more complex projects.

name: Skilled Learning
description: After mastering the basics of CSS, I wanted to learn a CSS-in-JS library. I chose Styled Components and built this landing page. I also used React to build the project and deployed it on Netlify. This project also helped me pick up some new CSS skills along the way, in the form of CSS Grids for responsive layouts.

name: Splitter
description: A tip calculator app built using TailwindCSS. Using this app, users are able to split the bill and tip amount between multiple people. The app is responsive and works on both desktop and mobile. I built this project to learn TailwindCSS and to get more comfortable with JavaScript.

name: Refriendo
description: I built a social media platform for people to create and host events in their neighbourhoods and friend circles. The project involved several features such as a feed, event creation, event hosting, management, discovery, and more. For this project, I designed the UI/UX with Figma, Frontend with React, and Backend with Go and MongoDB.

name: Whatsapp UI Clone
description: I literally have no idea why I did this. One day I decided to just build a pixel-perfect clone of the Whatsapp desktop UI and I did. I found this repo while cleaning up my Github and thought it was cool enough for my portfolio lol.
